summary.para: Represents a set of unique strings. This information is used by the binary encoding to write a more compact xml document.

remarks.para: All strings and values within a dictionary must be unique. Dictionaries are always assumed to be well-formed, so it is up to the creator of the dictionary to ensure that this is the case.
A dictionary might be declared as:
Strings from the dictionary might be used as:

summary.para: A guid that uniquely identifies the set of strings represented by the dictionary. The guid is never transmitted or persisted, and needs to only be unique for the lifetime of the process.
The set of unique strings that comprise the dictionary.
Specifies the number of strings in the dictionary.
Indicates if the dictionary and its contents are declared const and that they will be kept valid for the entire lifetime of any object with which strings in the dictionary are used.
If this is TRUE, then the strings can be manipulated more efficiently.
